details.bio:
LEGENDS AND LORE

With an Arcana check, characters can learn the following:

DC 10 Mindworms look harmless, but are not.

DC 15 Hailing from a distant plane, Mindworms feed on sapient thought.

DC 20 In the Mindscape, Mindworms are incredibly powerful.

DESCRIPTION

Among the stranger thoughtform entities, mind worms are both thoughtform and aberration in the world in one disturbing entity. Nearly blind in the waking world, a mind worm is less than an inch in length, pinkish-red, and spotted like a leopard with dark ruddy brown spots. Lacking a mouth or any other orifice, the wriggling worm slides along the ground aided by a thin layer of mucus.

However this unassuming little creature projects an incredibly dangerous mindscape threat. Easily sixty feet in length, the mindworm’s idealized form has a huge mouth filled with myriad teeth, its body is striated with plates, and it is capable of sight on par with a human. And within that mindscape, the worm is hunger made manifest. For these strange creatures feed on minds.

Thought Feeders. The Mindworm consumes sapient thoughts. The more complex and involved the thought, the greater the sustenance for the mindworm. As a result, mindworms seek out ever more complex thought when possible, and typically target creatures with higher intelligence. However, as they are blind and writhing worms, they’re not exceptionally picky so long as something is available. 

Innocuous Horror. Mindworms can infect a community, person by person, slowly reducing the populace into nigh-mindless zombies that go through the motions of their daily life almost by muscle memory. In some planar cultures this is referred to as ‘the waking death’.

Terrifying Wormhemoths. Once attached to a living creature, the Mindworm empowers their host with powerful psionic protections to ensure that it lives. This thought-armor is powered by the host’s mind, and grows in strength based on how long the worm has infected its host, and how much of its mind the worm has been able to consume.

BEHAVIOR

1 An animal that should not be placid approaches the party but makes no violent threats or actions, it dies within a day and the mindworm tries to take a new host.

2 A group of Mindworm Zombies dressed as circus folk or performers ham-handedly struggles through a performance in an attempt to get close, then attacks.

3 A goblin chieftain leads a raiding party, but her heart really isn’t in it by the lax discipline and quietness of her war warble, she immediately offers to surrender to the smartest party member.

4 (Mindscape) Thoughtforms flee from a wrinkled environment, begging for aid. But no matter how fast they run, they never get to the edge of the effect, which warps reality around them to draw them in deeper.

5 A Fae Knight and his entourage, afflicted with Mindworms, seek to subjugate other coteries in the Fae Realms.

6 A tiny worm wriggles in the road after a rainstorm. Unlike the others, this one is red with spots.

SIGNS

1 A disaffected populace that seems to react slowly to conversation.

2 Bodies left in the streets and houses of an abandoned community with no signs of violence.

3 Wild animals that don’t seem to register the presence of danger or people as a threat.

4 The Mindscape shifts and bulges with wrinkles not unlike the surface of a brain.

MONSTER TYPE DESCRIPTION

Within the realms of mind, dreams, and death there are monsters few speak of but most have imagined. For it is from the imagination that they are drawn and formed. These strange and ideomorphic creatures are often referred to as Thoughtforms, though some are as physical as any halfling or dragon one might encounter.

system.description: Mindworms possess blindsense out to 20ft. They are also aware of all minds within 10ft and their relative strengths.

After being attached to a host with an intelligence of 8 or higher for 8 hours, the host gains disadvantage on intelligence and wisdom skill checks and the worm gains +50 temporary HP. Each 24 hours after that, the worm gains an additional +50 temporary HP up to a maximum of 400. These temporary HP apply to attacks against the mindworm and the host in both the mindscape and reality. After 1 week, the host has disadvantage on all intelligence checks. After 1 month, the host becomes a mindworm zombie.

effects.name: Imagined Consumption
effects.description: Gains disadvantage on intelligence and wisdom skill checks.

system.description: The Mindworm gains advantage on stealth checks to hide when connected to a host, and may attach itself to any creature it shares a space with.

Mindworms possess the Range, Harm, and Split Basic Augments, and has a reservoir of 8d8 psi dice.

  • Range: +60ft per Psi Dice (Unless the target is Self)

  • Harm: +1d8 per Psi Dice (Assuming the power deals damage)

  • Split: The power targets an additional creature or object per Psi Dice.

Mindworms have abilities marked “Mindscape”. These actions can only be used while within the mindscape. When perceived in the Mindscape a Mindworm becomes a huge creature on par with most dragons in bulk and a movement rate of 60ft.
The Mindworm makes a Bite and a Crush attack.

If the target is a creature it must make a Constitution Save DC 15 or become Poisoned and take an additional 8 (1d4+6) ongoing poison damage. The ongoing damage can be stopped with magical or psionic healing, or by spending an action to roll a Wisdom save, DC 15.

effects.name: Poisoned
effects.description: • A poisoned creature has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

system.description: If the target is medium sized or smaller they must make a DC 15 Strength or Dexterity save or become Grappled.

effects.name: Grappled
effects.description:
• A grappled creature's Speed becomes 0, and it can't benefit from bonuses to movement speeds.

  • If the grappler becomes incapacitated the condition ends.

  • If an effect removes the grappled creature from the reach of the grappler or grappling effect (such as when a creature is shoved away by the @UUID[Compendium.a5e.a5e-maneuvers.Item.i5m1k81burf6n2t9]{Doubleteam} combat maneuver) the condition ends.

system.description: The Mindworm wraps tightly around any creature that it has grappled. If a creature is grappled by the Mindworm, it constricts to deal an additional 11 (2d6+6) psychic damage. A DC 15 Strength save reduces the damage by half.

When the Mindworm fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

The Mindworm has 1 legendary resistance per day.

You can use the Grapple maneuver to grab or wrestle a creature. If you are able to make multiple attacks with the Attack action, this maneuver replaces one of them.

You must have at least one free hand to attempt a grapple, your target must be within your reach, and the target must be no more than one size category larger than you. The target makes a Strength or Dexterity saving throw against your maneuver DC. On a failure, you deal basic melee damage and the target becomes grappled (see Appendix A: Conditions on page 616). In addition to things that end the condition, you can release the target at any time (no action required).

Escaping a Grapple. While grappled, a creature can use its action to attempt to escape. It must succeed on a Strength or Dexterity saving throw against your maneuver DC.

Moving a Grappled Creature. When you move, you can drag or carry the grappled creature with you. When you do so, your Speed is halved, unless the creature's weight is within your carrying capacity and you are not encumbered by bulky items.

Freeing a Grappled Creature. You can use the Grapple maneuver to try to free another grappled or restrained creature. The creature grappling or restraining the target makes a Strength saving throw against your maneuver DC. If it fails the saving throw, the grappled or restrained creature is freed. Additionally, you may move the freed creature 5 feet in any direction.

While you cannot grapple a creature two or more size categories larger than you, you can grab onto it. By jumping onto its back or climbing up a limb, you can make a Strength or Dexterity saving throw against the creature's maneuver DC to cling to or balance upon its body. On a success, you move into the creature's space and can move upon its body as if it is difficult terrain.

While grabbing onto a larger creature, you gain advantage on attack rolls against it. The larger creature may be able to attack you as normal, depending on its limbs or attacks. It can also use an action or replace one of its attacks on its turn to try to dislodge you, such as shaking you loose or bashing you against a wall, forcing you to make a Strength or Dexterity saving throw against its maneuver DC or fall prone into the nearest space adjacent to the creature, taking its basic melee damage in the process.

If the creature chooses to roll over in order to dislodge you, it becomes prone, but you have disadvantage on the saving throw to hang on.

You can use the Disarm maneuver to attempt to knock an item or weapon from a creature's hand. If you are able to make multiple attacks with the Attack action, this maneuver replaces one of them.

The target must be within your reach and be holding an item (either carried or wielded). The target makes a Strength or Dexterity saving throw against your maneuver DC. On a failure, you deal basic melee damage and the target drops the item in its space. The target has advantage if it is larger than you or holding the item with two or more hands, and a target smaller than you has disadvantage.

You can use the Knockdown maneuver to trip or push a creature down. If you are able to make multiple attacks with the Attack action, this maneuver replaces one of them.

The target must be within your reach and be no more than one size category larger than you. The target makes a Strength saving throw against your maneuver DC. On a failure, you deal basic melee damage and knock the target prone.

You can use an action or bonus action to make an Overrun maneuver to move through a hostile creature's space by forcing your way past. Make a Strength saving throw against the target's maneuver DC. On a success, you deal basic melee damage and can move through the hostile creature's space once this turn. The creature can choose to just let you pass instead of rolling. You have advantage if you are larger than the target, or disadvantage if you are smaller. If you are two or more sizes smaller than the target, you can move through the hostile creature's space without making a save. You still provoke opportunity attacks if you move beyond a creature's reach.

You can use the Shove maneuver to push a creature away. If you are able to make multiple attacks with the Attack action, this maneuver replaces one of them.

The target must be within your reach and be no more than one size category larger than you. The target makes a Strength saving throw against your maneuver DC. On a failure, you deal basic melee damage and push the target a number of feet away from you equal to 5 + 5 for every 5 points it failed its saving throw by. You can move the creature in any direction away from you (to the side, forward, or diagonally away).

A creature that is shoved off of a precipice is propelled off of whatever it is standing on -- it does not receive any saving throw or ability check to grab onto something to avoid falling down below.

You use telekinesis to strike a creature or manipulate an object you can see within range. As an attack this deals 1d8 + your esper level points of Bludgeoning damage with a Strength Save for half damage. If you choose to move an object you can manipulate it as if holding it in one hand, and it may weigh up to your Intelligence score in pounds.

Augments:

Weight Limit: +50lbs augment spent

Augments requiring two Psi Dice:

Manipulate: A creature that fails its strength save against this discipline is pushed up to 15ft in a direction of your choice.

Augments requiring requiring three Psi Dice:

Flight: You, or another target within range are lifted off the ground and carried a short distance. You gain a flight speed of 40ft for 1 round. If you do not land before the end of the round you may hover long enough to expend additional power points to maintain your flight, but if you do not spend those points you immediately fall.

Lift: A creature that fails its strength save against this discipline is instead lifted into the air for one turn, up to 15ft. While suspended in this way the target cannot move from its current space. This effect ends at the start of your next turn unless you immediately roll 3 augments to continue the effect.

effects.name: Flight
effects.description: Gain a flight speed of 40ft for 1 round.

effects.name: Lift
effects.description: Lifted into the air for one turn, up to 15ft. While suspended in this way the target cannot move from its current space.

system.description:
You may use telepathic contact to assail or communicate with a creature within range. When you assault the target they must make a Wisdom save or take 1d10 + your esper level points of Psychic damage. When you attempt to communicate you’re able to transfer meaning to and from your target, allowing for the sharing of words and emotion, regardless of any language barrier. Though creatures without language, such as a beast, will be incapable of providing words in return and may not understand words that you share.

Augments:

Learning: You may attempt to subtly take information from your target by listening in to their active thoughts.

Augments requiring Two Psi Dice:

Overwhelm: Roll 10d4 and compare the value to the target’s current hit points. If the value equals or exceeds the target’s hit points they immediately fall into natural sleep.

Invade: You may attempt to steal a memory from your target. Doing so causes your target to make a Wisdom Save. On a failure you are able to select one memory, generally an hour or less, and gain it for yourself. At your discretion, your target loses access to that memory for 24 hours.

Augments requiring three Psi Dice:

Traumatic Interference: You assail your target’s mind in a manner that is so traumatic and painful that your target gains a Short-Term Mental Stress Effect of your choosing for the next 1 minute.

effects.name: Traumatic Interference
effects.description: Gains a Short-Term Mental Stress Effect of your choosing for the next 1 minute.

system.description:
Target: A number of Creatures equal to your Psionic Ability Modifier.

Perception is reality, and you have learned to alter the perceptions of entire groups of creatures at the same time, shifting their understanding of reality in one of the following ways. When you manifest this power, each target may make a Wisdom saving throw against the effect.

Addition: Your targets perceive twice as much of something. If they are looking on a group of creatures, that group appears to have twice as many people in it, with any incongruities in space accounted for by distortion of the shared space. This effect only functions on discrete objects and not things like the digital printout of an object’s value, but would make a pile of credits appear to be twice as large.

Subtraction: You remove a single entity or object from your target’s perception. Any investigation or perception check to locate the object, no matter how large or obvious, is made at disadvantage, and the subtracted creature or object may make stealth checks without cover or concealment. Examples include an allied creature or the Exit Door of a room. For objects, set the Investigation or Perception DC as equal to your Psionics saving throw DC.

Creation: Your targets perceive an entity or object taking up to a 10ft cube of space. This entity or object cannot move from that location, though it can move within that space if it is smaller than 10ft on a side. If you choose, the creation may also make noises such as words or music, regardless of how inappropriate that would be for your creation. Example: A dog playing a jazz saxophone.

Any target which interacts with the addition or creation function of this power cannot use expertise on any skill check related to the illusion. This effect lasts for up to 1 minute so long as you maintain concentration.

Augments:

Duration: +1 minute per Augment.

Swap: Your targets perceive two entities or objects as being in opposite locations. For example you may cause them to perceive you as being one of their allies, and that ally as you. Directly interacting with either swapped entity or object triggers an immediate Wisdom saving throw to end the effect.

Augments requiring two Psi Dice:

Additional Effect: You may simultaneously use two separate effects, such as Subtraction and Creation, rather than only one.

Deletion: When you Subtract a creature or object from perception your targets become incapable of perceiving that creature or object whatsoever. Any perception or investigation check to locate the creature or object automatically fails and the creature or object cannot be attacked or interacted with by the targets. If a creature deleted in this way attacks a target that cannot perceive it, this power immediately ends for that target, alone.

Expansion: Increase the range of this power by a factor of 10 for every 2 Augments, as well as the space a Creation can occupy.
